name: Introduction to AI Ethics
description: Explore the ethical implications of artificial intelligence in modern society through collaborative discussions and case studies.

sessions.title: Understanding AI Bias
sessions.topic: Examine how bias enters AI systems and its real-world impacts
sessions.guide:
In this session, you will explore the concept of AI bias. Start by reading the provided articles on algorithmic bias in hiring and criminal justice systems. Then, analyze a real-world case study and write a 500-word reflection on the ethical implications.

**Key Questions to Consider:**
- How does bias enter AI systems?
- What are the consequences of biased AI?
- Who is responsible for addressing AI bias?

rubric.description: Demonstrates clear understanding of how bias enters AI systems
Provides thoughtful analysis of real-world implications
Shows evidence of critical evaluation and synthesis
Clear, well-organized writing with proper citations

templates.name: Reflection Essay Template
templates.content:
# AI Bias Reflection

## Introduction
[Introduce the topic and your thesis]

## Analysis of AI Bias
[Discuss how bias enters AI systems]

## Real-World Impact
[Analyze specific examples and consequences]

## Ethical Implications
[Discuss who is responsible and what should be done]

## Conclusion
[Summarize your key insights]

## References
[List your sources]

sessions.title: Privacy in the Age of AI
sessions.topic: Examine data privacy concerns and AI surveillance technologies
sessions.guide:
This session focuses on privacy implications of AI technologies. You will research current privacy regulations and analyze how AI systems collect, process, and use personal data.

**Learning Objectives:**
- Understand key privacy concepts (consent, data minimization, purpose limitation)
- Analyze privacy policies of AI-powered services
- Propose privacy-preserving AI practices

rubric.description: Demonstrates understanding of key privacy principles
Shows awareness of relevant privacy regulations
Provides thorough analysis of privacy implications

sessions.title: AI and Employment
sessions.topic: Analyze the impact of AI automation on jobs and workforce
sessions.guide:
In this session, we examine how AI is transforming the job market. You will research automation trends, analyze job displacement concerns, and propose strategies for workforce adaptation.

**Key Areas:**
- Current state of AI automation
- Jobs at risk vs. jobs created
- Reskilling and education strategies

rubric.description: Uses credible sources and current data
Provides comprehensive analysis of automation impact

templates.name: Analysis Report Template
templates.content:
# AI and Employment Analysis

## Executive Summary
[Brief overview of findings]

## Current State of AI Automation
[Describe current trends]

## Impact Analysis
### Jobs at Risk
[Identify vulnerable sectors]

### New Opportunities
[Discuss emerging roles]

## Stakeholder Perspectives
[Consider workers, employers, policymakers]

## Recommendations
[Propose strategies]

## Conclusion
[Final thoughts]

sessions.title: Responsible AI Development
sessions.topic: Learn principles and practices for ethical AI development
sessions.guide:
This hands-on session introduces responsible AI development practices. You will implement basic fairness checks and documentation for an AI model.

**Technical Objectives:**
- Implement bias detection functions
- Create model cards for documentation
- Apply fairness metrics

templates.name: Python Starter
templates.content:

sessions.title: AI Governance Frameworks
sessions.topic: Study global AI governance approaches and policy frameworks
sessions.guide:
This session examines AI governance frameworks from around the world. You will compare different regulatory approaches and create a policy brief.

**Focus Areas:**
- EU AI Act
- US AI governance
- International coordination efforts

rubric.description: Critical analysis of strengths and weaknesses

sessions.title: Final Project: AI Ethics Case Study
sessions.topic: Apply course concepts to analyze a comprehensive AI ethics case
sessions.guide:
For your final project, you will conduct an in-depth analysis of an AI ethics case of your choosing. Apply all concepts learned throughout the course.

**Requirements:**
- Select a real-world AI system or application
- Analyze ethical implications across multiple dimensions
- Propose improvements and governance recommendations
- Minimum 2000 words

name: Data Visualization Fundamentals
description: Learn to create compelling data visualizations that tell stories and drive insights.

sessions.title: Principles of Visual Design
sessions.topic: Learn fundamental visual design principles for effective data communication
sessions.guide: This session covers the foundational principles of visual design as they apply to data visualization.

sessions.title: Choosing the Right Chart
sessions.topic: Learn when to use different chart types for various data stories
sessions.guide: Explore the strengths and weaknesses of different chart types.

sessions.title: Interactive Visualizations
sessions.topic: Build interactive data visualizations with modern tools
sessions.guide: Create interactive visualizations using JavaScript libraries.

name: Climate Change Communication
description: Completed project on effectively communicating climate science to diverse audiences.

sessions.title: Climate Science Basics
sessions.topic: Foundation of climate science for communication
sessions.guide: Learn the fundamental climate science concepts needed for effective communication.

sessions.title: Audience Analysis
sessions.topic: Understanding and adapting to different audiences
sessions.guide: Analyze different audience types and their climate communication needs.

sessions.title: Visual Communication
sessions.topic: Using visuals to communicate climate data
sessions.guide: Create compelling visual representations of climate data.

sessions.title: Final Campaign
sessions.topic: Design a complete climate communication campaign
sessions.guide: Apply all learned concepts to create a comprehensive climate communication campaign.
